item.title: Best One Piece Games For Exploration
item.description:
Summary

  • There are many One Piece video games that allow players to fully explore vast locations, whether they are based on places from the anime or are entirely original.
  • One Piece Odyssey provides conventional RPG gameplay with strategic battles and fun overworld exploration of classic locations.
  • The Unlimited series, especially with Unlimited Adventure and Unlimited Cruise , blends combat with exploration seamlessly.

One Piece is, first and foremost, an action-adventure series, with one of its biggest appeals being all the colorful and unique locations that the Straw Hat Pirates get to visit and explore. This is something that many developers have tried to translate to the medium of video games, with varying levels of success.

After all, multiple One Piece games have been released since the series’ inception, but very few of them actually let players explore huge maps that are based on iconic locations from the original manga/anime. As a result, the following video games are perfect for fans who just want to enjoy some well-made exploration .

Pirate Warriors Series

Players Can Run Around Huge Battlefields That Are Brimming With Enemies

One Piece: Pirate Warriors 4
9.3 /10
Released
March 27, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

One Piece has many video game subseries, with one of the most notorious and popular ones being One Piece: Pirate Warriors . These are “Musou” games that focus more on the action than the exploration, but they still let players visit some of their favorite locations from the source material, like Orange Town, Marineford, Whole Cake Château, Wano, and more.

The main goal of these games is to run around a giant battlefield while defeating massive hordes of enemies and the occasional boss characters, but players are also encouraged to freely explore the maps to find hidden paths and some collectibles. Even though exploration is not the main selling point of the Pirate Warriors games, it can be surprisingly deep, enjoyable, and relaxing at times, especially when there are no enemies around.

One Piece Odyssey

An RPG That Lets Players Explore Maps Based On Classic Locations

One Piece Odyssey
7 /10
10.0 /10
Released
January 13, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

One Piece Odyssey , the most recent console video game in the franchise, is a simple but effective RPG reminiscent of classic IPs like Dragon Age or Final Fantasy . Naturally, this means that its gameplay is divided into two halves: the strategic turn-based battles and the fun overworld exploration, and they’re both very important to the overall experience.

When players are not engaging in battle, they can explore different maps and use each Straw Hat’s specific skills to unlock new areas, solve puzzles, and find items. It’s very basic RPG gameplay, but it is still very engaging and entertaining, especially during the nostalgic segments that take place inside memory-based recreations of beloved locations from the anime/manga, like Arabasta, Water 7, Marineford, and Dressrosa.

One Piece: Unlimited World Red

The Most Modern Entry In This Fun Action-Adventure Subseries

One Piece: Unlimited World Red
8.3 /10
Released
July 8, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Cartoon Violence, Comic Mischief, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Tobacco
Powered by

One Piece fans who want to play games that focus more on the adventure than the action should look no further than the Unlimited trilogy, with its most recent entry being 2013’s One Piece: Unlimited World Red . While the exploration of this game is not as deep as in the previous entries, it still allows players to control Luffy and explore semi-open world maps that are full of things to do and secrets to find.

The maps in Unlimited World Red feature NPCs that give advice and side quests to the player, and points of interest that have treasure chests and other items of importance within them. Of course, the fast-paced beat 'em up gameplay is the main selling point of this game, but its relatively solid exploration is still much deeper and more refined than most other video games in this huge franchise.

One Piece: Unlimited Adventure

The Perfect Blend Of Combat And Exploration

One Piece: Unlimited Adventure
Released
April 26, 2007

Powered by

The Unlimited series kicked off in 2007, with the release of One Piece: Unlimited Adventure for the Nintendo Wii, and it still remains one of the most beloved games in the entire franchise by most fans. This game features an all-new original story and setting that serves as an excuse for players to take control of the Straw Hats and explore a fascinating semi-open world map.

While combat is a big focus of Ultimate Adventure , exploration is also a crucial part of the gameplay experience, as the player will need to engage in 3D platforming, solve puzzles, fish, catch bugs, and even search for materials, so Franky and Usopp can create tools and gadgets with them. There's no denying that this is one of the few One Piece video games that has managed to fully capture the series’ signature sense of adventure.

One Piece: Unlimited Cruise

A Perfect Sequel, And The Best Entry In The Unlimited Trilogy

One Piece: Unlimited Cruise 1 - The Treasure Beneath the Waves
Released
September 11, 2008

Powered by

Two years later, Bandai Namco released a direct sequel to Unlimited Adventure , titled One Piece: Unlimited Cruise , and it ended up being even better than its predecessor. Like any good sequel, everything in Unlimited Cruise , like the graphics and the action, is just bigger, better, and more polished. But, of course, the biggest standout is the surprisingly deep exploration.

Once again, players can control all the members of the Straw Hat Pirates while they explore semi-open world maps, where they can find materials, solve puzzles, fight enemies, and more. Not only is the gameplay faster and more fluid now, but the Straw Hats can also use their specific abilities to get access to new areas: Brook can run on water, Franky can build bridges on command, Nami can drive her Waver, etc. These are brilliant ideas that other games in the franchise, made by other studios, like One Piece Odyssey , would also end up implementing for their exploration.

One Piece: World Seeker

The Only True Open-World Console Game In The Entire Franchise

One Piece: World Seeker
Adventure
Systems
Released
March 14, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Fans have been asking Shueisha and Bandai Namco for a Triple-A open-world One Piece video game for many years, and this dream finally came into fruition in 2019, when One Piece: World Seeker came out on PS4, Xbox One, and PC. This is an action-adventure title in which players take control of Luffy and explore a massive open world that’s brimming with NPCs, items, enemies, puzzles, and side quests.

Some aspects of World Seeker ended up disappointing most fans, but the exploration was definitely one of them. Not only does the game’s map feel alive and crowded, but it also takes perfect advantage of Luffy’s rubber abilities to make the traversal and the exploration even more fluid and enjoyable, in a way that reminded most players of Insomniac’s recent Spider-Man games. On top of that, other characters like Zoro, Sabo, and Law are playable via DLC, and they all have their unique abilities for both combat and adventuring. This game takes place in a new location called Jail Island, which is admittedly quite interesting, but if Bandai Namco ever greenlights a sequel, its solid gameplay formula should be used to explore classic One Piece locations instead.

item.title: How to Get the Toxic Fumes Achievement in Ready or Not
item.description:
Achievements in Ready or Not range from deceptively easy to painfully hard, and as far as the Toxic Fumes one goes, it falls mostly under the former camp. It's a straightforward Trophy to achieve, but as with everything else in the game, it's going to take a bit of effort to unlock.

Toxic Fumes isn't as hidden as The Devil or Temperance achievements in Ready or Not , but it will have players going through some hoops. Thankfully, it's not hard to get, and some players might end up unlocking it without trying if they're gunning for an S-rank score for all missions in the game.

Ready or Not: Toxic Fumes Trophy Guide

To unlock this achievement, all players need to do is complete the Twisted Nerve mission in Ready or Not while using a CS Gas-oriented loadout. Specifically, you'll need to bring the following:

  • VPL-25 Rifle
  • Gas mask
  • CS Gas grenades

One important thing to note about the Toxic Fumes trophy is that you absolutely cannot use anything else when attempting it . The TRPL pistol and TPL SMG do not count toward this achievement despite being pepperball guns like the VPL-25, and the Beanbag Shotgun is completely out of the question.

The achievement's strict requirement also means you cannot use Flashbangs, Stingers, sidearms, or any of the M320 grenade launchers (including the M320 Gas).

AI Teammate Loadouts

Like other RoN achievements with loadout restrictions, NPC teammates can use anything without jeopardizing your odds of success. It doesn't matter if they go lethal or not, but if you want to get an S-rank on this mission, then arm them with the same loadout you have.

Things to Avoid

Ready or Not is very strict when it comes to loadout-based achievements , so if you're not unlocking Toxic Fumes even after clearing the mission with the right gear equipped, here are some things that might have caused your run to fail:

  • Lockpick Gun
  • Any Long Tactical gadget
  • Any grenade or tactical device other than CS Gas

As much as possible, don't even bother bringing out any of these items. The minute you interact with anything in the world using them, the achievement will get invalidated.

To be extra safe, make sure to convert all of your secondary weapon magazines into primary weapon mags. Not only do you get more ammo, but it also completely eliminates your sidearm as something that might potentially ruin your attempt.

Best Way to Get the Toxic Fumes Achievement

If you've tried completing Twisted Nerve several times without getting the achievement, try letting your AI teammates do everything for you . Much like in the Way Out West trophy, Toxic Fumes can be completed without you ever having to fire a shot or interact with anything. Just order your team to take care of everything for you. Still, make sure that you yourself satisfy the loadout requirement and that you're playing on Standard difficulty or higher .

If the achievement still isn't popping for you, try disabling any mods you have installed.

Ready or Not
8 /10
19
8.2 /10
Released
December 13, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Void Interactive
Publisher(s)
Void Interactive
Engine
Unreal Engine 4
Multiplayer
Online Multiplayer
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
How Long To Beat
20 Hours
Powered by

item.title: Best PS1 RPGs That Get Better As You Play
item.description:
Summary

  • Some PS1 RPGs require patience to get to the best parts, like Rhapsody's musical cutscenes.
  • RPGs like Legend of Dragoon and Xenogears have slow starts but offer unique mechanics.
  • Suikoden 2 improves on its predecessor with a tight combat system, but still requires time to recruit party members.

The PS1 generation provided RPG fans with a plethora of games to play. It even created some new RPG fans with the release of big hits like Final Fantasy 7 . While the console has a ton of great RPGs, that doesn't mean they all started with a bang. Some of the better ones require some patience.

Perhaps there is a lot of story upfront, or maybe some of the best mechanics are hidden deep into the game's core. Whatever the case may be, players should strive through the slow bits to get to the meat of these mighty PS1 RPGs. They will be included based on how well everything ramps up and the overall quality of the game. Although not ranked, the RPGs should improve progressively.

Rhapsody: A Musical Adventure

A Literal Musical RPG

  • Developer: NIS
  • Publisher: Atlus
  • Released: July 30, 2000 (NA PS1 Version)
  • Platforms: DS, PC PS1, PS5, Switch

Rhapsody: A Musical Adventure is an obscure late-era PS1 title that is part turn-based RPG, part musical. Most of the major cutscenes feature fully voiced songs akin to a Disney musical, except with more limited animation. This is not a long game, but it still takes a while for the vibes to fully sink in, from recruiting new party members to getting to some of the better songs. It’s part of a trilogy of games that took a long time to get localized, but if this game sounds intriguing, then fans may also want to check out Rhapsody: Marl Kingdom Chronicles .

Jade Cocoon

Ghibli’s Forest Pokemon

Jade Cocoon
Narrative
JRPG
Adventure
Action
Fantasy
Systems
Released
December 3, 1998
ESRB
t
Engine
unreal engine

Powered by

Ghibli fans may think Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch was the first major RPG that the anime studio lent their talent to, but years before that, there was Jade Cocoon . Set in an ancient society, players will venture on a quest to tame monsters for combat. It has a premise similar to a cross between Pokemon and Megami Tensei games, but with a slower build. It takes a while to get some of the cooler monsters to join the party, and the world doesn’t fully open up until a few dungeons are complete, but once it does, it's a blast to play.

The Legend Of Dragoon

Get To The Dragons

The Legend of Dragoon
8.8 /10
Released
June 14, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Animated Blood, Violence
Powered by

The Legend of Dragoon was a one-off that Sony helped publish and design for the PS1. It has a typical turn-based RPG system, except that players can time their attacks to do extra damage, akin to the Mario RPG games.

As the name suggests, dragons play a big role in the game, but getting to them takes a long time. Also, Dart, the hero, takes a while to get the party together, meaning that many of the early dungeons are tricky with just one or two characters.

Dragon Warrior 7

Late To The Party

Dragon Warrior 7
JRPG
Systems
Released
August 26, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Dragon Quest 7 was localized as Dragon Warrior 7 in the West, but both games are nearly identical. It was a late release for the PS1 and sports graphics marginally better than a SNES game. Graphics aren’t everything, though. There are neat things about this adventure, like the class system, Vocations, and the time-traveling aspect. Players will get their party together quickly, which is good, but they won’t have access to Vocations until they are hours deep. Plus, the first few puzzles make exploration a chore, which was fixed in the 3DS remake, which is the better way to experience this game.

Persona 2: Eternal Punishment

All Persona Games Are A Slow Burn

Persona 2: Eternal Punishment
JRPG
Systems
8.0 /10
Released
November 30, 2000
ESRB
t // Animated Blood, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes

Powered by

Persona 2: Innocent Sin is the first game in this duology, but only its sequel, Persona 2: Eternal Punishment , was made available in North America. There is a continuation in the narrative too, featuring returning characters like Maya, who was playable in the first game but is now the main character. This alone made it challenging to get into when the game was first released on the PS1, but Persona fans know that most games require patience for the first few hours anyway. Once the Persona system is better understood and the story kicks into high gear, players will enjoy this classic more.

Xenogears

Get To The Mechs Already

Xenogears
10.0 /10
Released
October 20, 1998

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Xenogears tried to do a lot, which made the pacing a bit uneven. The battle system should hook players in quickly, as it’s a mashup between a classic turn-based RPG and a fighting game’s combo system. However, the narrative is not immediately compelling as there are a lot of terms and characters to memorize, and this doesn’t get easier with all the religious influences. The coolest part of the game is the mechs, which do not unlock as fast as they should. But once they do, players are in for a treat.

Front Mission 3

A Linear Challenge

Front Mission 3
7.0 /10
Released
September 2, 1999

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Front Mission 3 does give players mechs quickly, Wanzers, but it still has some similar issues to Xenogears . The trouble initially is the challenge level, as players only have three characters while enemies always outnumber them on the tactical RPG maps. Strict strategies and a lot of luck are needed to get through these early maps. Also, the big hook of Front Mission games is mech customization, and it takes just as long to get new parts as it does to get a new party member. The grind is worth it, even though Front Mission 3 has one of the hardest openings.

Suikoden 2

Building A Resistance

Suikoden II
JRPG
Systems
10.0 /10
Released
September 29, 1999
ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Mild Violence, Suggestive Themes

Powered by

Suikoden 2 is a better game compared to its predecessor in almost every way. The story is more intriguing, the combat is tighter, and the sprite work is just a tad cleaner. Unfortunately, it still takes time to get to the core of the Suikoden series: finding hundreds of party members. Players are building a resistance to fight back against an evil empire, and they have to build a base and fill it with party members to man things like shops. It’s not an easy task, but it is rewarding.

item.title: Borderlands 4's Vault Hunters Prove You Can't Judge a Book By Its Cover
item.description:
Borderlands 4 is arguably the franchise's last chance to innovate, and so far, it has proven that it might actually have what it takes. With its seamless exploration on the new planet Kairos, unprecedented traversal mechanics, a greater focus on RPG, and much more serious tone in its storytelling, Borderlands 4 is somehow still a Borderlands game and yet already looks like something entirely different from what fans have experienced so far. This design philosophy has even impacted the game's new Vault Hunters as well, as Borderlands 4 has seemingly given its iconic arsenal of guns the backseat in exchange for some truly interesting heroes riding shotgun.

Over the last several weeks, Borderlands 4 has been unveiling its Vault Hunters in stylish fashion, showing off bits and pieces of their gameplay across multiple trailers, and the more that is shown, the tougher it gets to decide which one of them is the best pick. From Vex the Siren with her ability to summon familiars to Amon with his versatility and build flexibility, Borderlands 4 's Vault Hunters are certainly proving to be something special. Ironically, they weren't always viewed that way, as they failed to leave a good first impression, regardless of the excitement they are stirring now.

Borderlands 4's Vault Hunters Have More Than Proven Themselves

Borderlands 4's Vault Hunters Were Initially Underestimated

When they were first revealed in Borderlands 4 's world premiere trailer shown at the 2024 Game Awards, many fans expressed disappointment in the game's Vault Hunters on account of their overall blandness. What many perceived was a group of playable characters who lacked the dramatic flair and over-the-top personality that Borderlands ' past Vault Hunters possessed. The group of heroes were even criticized as appearing as though they were merely cosplaying as Vault Hunters, with the familiar comic-book aesthetics largely missing.

Some even pointed out that every member of the group was human — no aliens or robots — which made them almost blend into the background rather than stand out as they should have. This also led to confusion about their classes, since each one of them not only appeared to be far too normal but also seemed to be too much like the others. Finally, in comparison to Borderlands 4 's new planet and new enemies, the Vault Hunters were criticized as being too boring by comparison.

The Latest Reveals Prove Borderlands 4's Vault Hunters Mean Business

However, the latest reveals for Borderlands 4 's Vault Hunters have been doing quite a number on their previous reputation, showing each character to be far more than meets the eye. The full extent of Harlowe's skillset has yet to be truly revealed via gameplay footage, but Vex, Rafa, and Amon have all already received deep dive trailers for their gameplay, and anticipation has only grown. What Borderlands 4 has proven, more than anything else, is that a book shouldn't be judged by its cover, as although the game's Vault Hunters initially appeared to be underwhelming, they are far from it in substance.

Borderlands 4 's Amon, in particular, has struck a chord recently with fans, as his three skill trees allow him to specialize in melee, ranged, and defensive combat. Plus, with the ability players will have to mix and match skills across trees, he can essentially be a powerhouse of their choosing. Vex and Rafa have also both received praise, with Vex hogging the spotlight at first but Rafa coming in hot with some fast-paced Devil May Cry -like gameplay. And then there's Harlowe still to come, whose skills have already been confirmed to center around AoE and crowd control. Needless to say, these are shaping up to be the Vault Hunters the series has needed for quite some time, showing that even someone who looks underwhelming can still be an overwhelming force of nature.

8 Images
8 Images
Follow
Followed

item.title: Elden Ring: Best Armor Sets For Melee Builds
item.description:
Quick Links

  • The Solutide Set
  • Divine Beast Set
  • Cleanrot Set
  • Lionel's Set
  • Malenia's Set
  • Tree Sentinel Set
  • Raptor's Set
  • War Surgeon Set
  • Fire Prelate Set
  • Malformed Dragon Set
  • Black Knife Set
  • Blaidd's Set
  • Royal Remains Set
  • Hoslow's Set
  • Crucible Axe/Tree Set
  • Scaled Set
  • Banished Knight Set
  • Radahn's Set
  • Veteran Set
  • Bull-Goat Set

In Elden Ring , players are called the Tarnished, but that doesn't mean they have to look the part. And while the game somewhat encourages that by mostly presenting players with Salvation Army duds, there are still numerous second-hand armor options that look great for melee characters.

All of them help players achieve or become a part of the true endgame in Elden Ring : Elden Bling. It's where the most stylish and most glamorous of Tarnished gather which may or may not result in fight clubs or spiteful PVP, but hey, at least you look good while blaspheming or ganking others.

Updated August 7, 2025 by Erik Petrovich : In the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, Elden Ring armor sets expanded with a lot of new fashionable and useful options. Though many of the best armor sets in Elden Ring offer players set bonuses or passive stat buffs, some of the best sets for melee builds just need to provide great defenses. The Solitude Set, which can be found near the start of the DLC's Realm of Shadow, has great physical defenses and very high poise, though its nearly 60 equip load will weigh down all but the strongest players. This list has been updated to include the impressive and intimidating Black Knight set and explain what makes it one of the best armor sets for melee builds in Elden Ring.

20 The Solutide Set

Go Absolutely Medieval On 'Em

Part of a heavy armor set that covers the whole body in overlapping plates of steel.

The nameless mausoleums of the realm of shadow are said to hold the spirits of warriors who lost their names, or their hearts.

Worn By

The Blackgaol Knight

Main Benefit

High defenses and weight, incredible Fashion Souls potential

Weight

10.3

Rarely are FromSoftware fans given an armor set that offers both great stats and great fashion. Though it does not have any notable buffs or set bonuses like other armor sets in Elden Ring , the Solitude Set offers very high physical defenses and is one of the coolest-looking armor sets in the game.

The helmet alone raises the Elden Bling of many other sets, but it looks best when equipped alongside the matching cuirass, gauntlets, and greaves.

The Solitude Armor design is thought by some to be inspired by the Berserker set from Berserk , a series that FromSoftware games tend to reference.

With all pieces equipped, the Solitude Set provides higher poise and higher physical damage negation than many heavy armor sets in the base game. At a total 57.1 weight, though, you'll still have to level Endurance quite a bit to stay within Medium Weight with a weapon equipped.

Solitude Set Location

To get the Solitude set, Elden Ring players must defeat the Blackgaol Knight in the Western Nameless Mausoleum, in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. From the spawn point in the Gravesite Plain, head north and hug the western wall to reach the Western Nameless Mausoleum surrounded by gravebirds. You can also go directly west from the Scorched Ruins.

19 Divine Beast Set

Boosts STR, DEX, And Storm Damage

Armor of feted horned warriors chosen to become divine beast warriors, adorned with a lion's pelt.

Among the divine beast warriors, only those who truly excel at divine invocation become sculpted keepers, and are granted the honor of the lion dance.

Worn By

Divine Beast Warriors, NOT Divine Beast Dancing Lion

Main Benefit

Bonuses to STR and DEX, but reduces Flask healing and Focus

Weight

5.1

Though most of the best melee armor sets Elden Ring players can get have a high weight and defensive properties, the Divine Beast Set is particularly good for players who want to keep their Equip Load low. At a Light Equip Load your Dodge Roll becomes improved with more i-frames and a longer distance, so having less defense can actually mean taking less hits – especially when one takes Scadutree Blessing bonuses into account.

The main draw of this set over other melee build armor sets in Elden Ring is its bonuses to Strength, Dexterity, and Storm-type spells and attacks. It does come at the cost of a slightly reduced Flask of Crimson Tears healing, and slightly lower Focus, but it's a handy boost if you don't plan on getting hit.

The Divine Beast armor set is also particularly good for Rune Level 1 builds, though it does require getting to the final zone of the DLC.

Divine Beast Set Location

To get the Divine Beast set, Elden Ring players must defeat Divine Beast warriors near the end of the DLC, in the final location unlocked after defeating Messmer the Impaler. These are very strong enemies, and they are few in number, so this set is relatively hard to farm efficiently.

18 Cleanrot Set

Great Style & Resistances

Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering.

The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh.

Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

Worn By

Cleanrot Knights

Main Benefit

Well-rounded armor with great elemental resistance

Weight

35.7

Particularly in the early and middle portions of the players' journey, the Cleanrot is a great set for safeguarding the Tarnished in a number of ways. The armor offers solid defense and resistance to Hemorrhage and Frostbite and can absorb both physical and elemental damage quite well.

It's fairly versatile and well-rounded, making it a good option for beginner melee brawlers. Moreover, it's just a "clean", elegant set to admire while also striking a rather intimidating appearance with its rugged-knight mail design. It certainly helps that it's fairly easy to get compared to some of the more exclusive sets that offer similar protection.

Cleanrot Set Location

To get the Cleanrot Set, you must farm Lesser Cleanrot Knights in Caelid, specifically in the Heart of Aeonia and in the Aeonia swamp in general.

17 Lionel's Set

One Of The Highest Poise Sets In The Base Game

Worn by the Lionel the Lionhearted.

When this chivalrous dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Worn By

Lionel the Lionhearted

Main Benefit

Potent robustness and poise, can strike right through certain enemy hits

Weight

50.5

Sure, it may look a bit ridiculous, but looks can be deceiving — and this "robust" set from Lionel the Lionhearted makes this point emphatically. It's also on the heavy side, to say the least, yet it's worth the extra load, given its solid nature and great damage reduction as well as unshakable poise.

In fact, it's so good in this area, that players can often attack right through certain enemy hits without being set back. Gamers will want to take the time to seek it out within the Lower Capital Church, which also yields a Site of Grace, where players hauling this heavy armor can get some brief respite.

Lionel's Set Location

To get Lionel's Set, you must go to the Lower Capital Church Site of Grace in Leyndell, and look on a bed in a nearby room within the same building for the armor set.

16 Malenia's Set

Now You, Too, Can Cosplay The Goddess Of Rot

Armor made of unalloyed gold. Worn by Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

Malenia awaited Miquella at the foot of the husk.

"My brother will keep his promise. He possesses the wisdom, the allure, of a god - he is the most fearsome Empyrean of all."

Worn By

Malenia Blade of Miquella

Main Benefit

Good magical and physical protection

Weight

20.5

While it's a rather lightweight set, Malenia's lavish armor can be surprisingly effective even for more melee-focused fighters. Players will still want to tread somewhat carefully when in close combat, though the solid Robustness and excellent Immunity (108) more than make up for any lack of poise or vitality.

In fact, weighing in its strengths, Malenia's Set is one of the best armor sets in the game as a whole statistically. Provided players are fine with a little bit of risk with close-up brawling, this is a great (and flashy) set that offers several defensive and resistance benefits. It's certainly solid given its lightweight nature.

Malenia's Set Location

To get Malenia's Set, you must purchase each piece for a total of 56,000 runes from Enia in Roundtable Hold after besting Malenia and turning in her Remembrance of the Rot Goddess.

15 Tree Sentinel Set

An Ornate Set That's Hard To Get

Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Adorned with a cape featuring the mark of the sacred tree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

Worn By

Tree Sentinel Boss

Main Benefit

Well-rounded and stylish armor

Weight

45

Players get a glimpse of one of the best and most stylish heavy armor sets in the game as soon as they step into Limgrave. The Tree Sentinel actually has a good armor set but sadly, he doesn't drop it. Players will have to head over to Auriza Heroes Grave in Altus Plateau and destroy the Chariots in order to get this armor.

The effort is well-rewarded though since the Tree Sentinel armor has about the same defensive stats and poise as Radahn's Set. It's also bulky yet glamorous as it's also one of the few armor sets in the game that looks well-kept and maintained.

Tree Sentinel Set Location

To get the Tree Sentinel Set, you must go to the Auriza Hero's Grave and break the Chariots, all three of them Once destroyed, the Tree Sentinel set should automatically be added to your inventory.

14 Raptor's Set

Boosts Jumping Attack Damage

Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount.

A ritual implement for transforming into a Deathbird, if only by imitation.

"We are birds of prey, bringers of death."

Worn By

The assassin Ravenmount

Main Benefit

Jump attack damage boost from the body armor

Weight

16.8

The Raptor's set is a considerable upgrade from the default Bandit's set worn as starting armor by the Bandit class. It's more special, however, as the body armor, Raptor's Black Feathers, enhances jump attack damage by a noticeable amount.

Furthermore, this buff stacks with the Claw Talisman for an even bigger jump attack increase. So it's pretty much a build-enabling armor set, especially for those that use twinblades or dual greatswords (or heavier). The defensive stats are decent enough and the style is impeccable.

Raptor's Set Location

To get the Raptor's Set, you must head to the Sage's Cave in the Altus Plateau and look behind an illusory wall to find two chests that contain the Skeletal Mask and the Raptor's Black Feathers, the two unique pieces to this set.

13 War Surgeon Set

Part Of A Nutritious, Balanced Bleed Build

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood none were able to tame the accursed blood.

None but Varré, that is; though he was an exception.

Worn By

White Mask Varre

Main Benefit

Mask gives Attack Rating boost triggered by nearby Blood Loss/Bleed

Weight

16.6

Ever wanted to have revenge against Varre's creepy, judgmental kind? Well, apart from killing them, one can also wear their clothing as some kind of trophy. It's not half-bad. The War Surgeon Set is dropped by the invaders in Mogwhyn Dynasty Mausoleum's bloody lake. They look like Varre.

The set itself is unimpressive when it comes to defense by the helmet or mask gives a good damage boost for Bleed builds. The mask gives a buff to Attack Rating once it detects a nearby Bleed proc. Players can even trigger this themselves using the Seppuku Ash of War.

War Surgeon Set Location

To get the War Surgeon Set, you must go to the Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum and be invaded by Nameless White Masks in the central pools. One of these invaders will drop the entire set.

12 Fire Prelate Set

Highest Fire Resistance

Attire of the Fire Prelates, commanders of the Fire Monks.

The weighty frames of the Prelates symbolized the onus of their grave vows as guardians of the flame.

"Etch this sight upon thine breast. Of my thunderous gravity."

Worn By

Prelates

Main Benefit

High poise, highest Fire resistance

Weight

58.8

Those who wear the Fire Prelate set likely won't do so for style. It's more likely that the Fire Giant or some fire-breathing dragon is starting to get on their nerves. Because this armor set is a desperate countermeasure against fire damage.

It boasts the highest fire resistance in the game and the difference compared to other sets is significant, meaning the fire damage mitigation is a lifesaver here. Apart from that, the poise is one of the highest in the game.

Fire Prelate Set Location

To get the Fire Prelate Set, you must defeat the Prelate in Guardian's Garrison in Mountaintop of the Giants, or farm it from any other Fire Prelate enemy - like the one outside the Giant-Conquering Hero's Grave.

11 Malformed Dragon Set

A Bizarre Set With High Resistances

Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.

After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany.

The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Worn By

Draconic Tree Sentinel

Main Benefit

Second-highest lightning resistance in the game

Weight

38

Apart from fire, lightning is another damage source that's frequently dealt by dragons, especially in late-game. Enemies in Crumbling Farum Azula also love to use lightning against players. So to counteract these cretins, the Malformed Dragon Set is the second-best option.

The best is the Bull-Goat set, but that thing weighs a ton and the lightning mitigation isn't that much higher. The downside, of course, is that it looks like a misshapen dragon egg so like the Fire Prelate set, this is also another desperate but effective attempt to survive certain bosses.

Malformed Dragon Set Location

To get the Malformed Dragon Set, you must defeat the Draconic Tree Sentinel world boss standing outside the entrance to Maliketh's boss arena, at the very end of Crumbling Farum Azula.
